title: Nigeria Cultural Parade in Downtown
address: Downtown Houston, Houston, TX 77010 United States
body: Celebrate Nigeria’s 57th Independence at the annual Nigeria Cultural Parade in the streets of Downtown. Admission Free to attend.

title: Fall Plant Sale at Houston Museum of Natural Science
address: 5555 Hermann Park Drive Houston, TX 77030 United States
body: Stop by the Cockrell Butterfly Center's Fall Plant Sale and stock up on a wide variety of native and tropical nectar plants, as well as host plants for other native butterflies. Admission 30-minute parking is free if you spend $30 or more.

title: Urban Homesteading: Tree Grafting at Finca Tres Robles
address:
257 N Greenwood St 
Houston , TX 77011 United States
body: Join TX/RX Labs at Finca Tres Robles to learn several types of grafting, how to collect and store bud wood, and the tricks and tips you need to know for growing success. Admission Tickets are $35.

title: Beginner Birdwatching at the Houston Arboretum & Nature Center
address:
4501 Woodway Drive 
Houston, TX 77024 United States
body: Learn how to find the perfect pair of binoculars, how to use them, what to look for in a field guide, and the basics of identifying birds in this beginners class at the Houston Arboretum & Nature Center. This class is ages 16 & up. Admission Tickets are $20 for members and $30 for nonmembers.

title: Caturday Morning Cartoons at El Gato Coffeehouse
address:
508 Pecore St, Suite A 
Houston , TX 77009 United States
body: Spend a lazy Saturday morning watching cat-themed cartoons from the '90s at this family-friendly event El Gato Coffeehouse Cat Cafe. Admission Tickets are $10 an hour for kids ages 5 to 17; $12 an hour with a student ID; $14 an hour for adults.

title: Looking Back History Tour at Buffalo Bayou Park
address:
1001 Commerce Street 
Houston , TX 77002 United States
body: Aboard BBP’s pontoon boat and take a look back to the late 1800s when Houston was founded with Louis Aulbach, local historian and author at Allen's Landing at Buffalo Bayou Park. Admission Tickets are $40 per person.

title: Mid Autumn Festival at Children’s Museum of Houston
address:
1500 Binz St 
Houston, TX 77004 United States
body: The Vietnamese Culture & Science Association partners with the Children’s Museum of Houston to hold a day of fun, including a lion dance, lantern making, face painting, traditional clothing showcase, and storytelling. They have free passes for families of financial need that may otherwise not be able to attend and can be picked up before the event at the VCSA Center. Otherwise, the first 200 visitors will get $3 off the regular museum admission.

title: Texas Ink & Art Expo in Galveston
address: 5600 Seawall Blvd Houston , TX 77554 United States
body: Ink lovers unite at this 3-day Tattoo Expo that will include live tattooing, tattoo art, contests, and even a freak show at the Galveston Island Convention Center. Admission Tickets are $20 per day or $35 for a 3-day pass.

title: Brewed in H-Town at The Anheuser-Busch Brewery
address: 775 Gellhorn Dr houston, TX 77029 United States
body: The Brewed in H-Town event combines a Bud Talk series along with a final celebration to celebrate the people of Houston through a gallery experience combining Budweiser’s brewing process with Houston style, music, and art. Enjoy a tour of the brewery and the chance to meet local Houstonians, artists, entrepreneurs and the Clydesdale horses. Admission: This event is free but ticketed.

title: Young Writers Workshop at Discovery Green
address:
1500 McKinney St 
Houston, TX 77010 United States
body: Writers in Schools conducts a writing workshop for the kiddos at Discovery Green Park. Limited to 25 students per workshop. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: Houston Oktoberfest at The Water Works
address:
105 Sabine Street 
Houston, TX 77007 United States
body: This craft beer festival brings a German twist, with polka music, German beers and brats, and the annual Oktoberfest Olympiad, featuring games like stein hoisting, brat tossing, and barrel rolling. Admission Advance tickets are $25 for general admission and $100 for VIP.

title: Circus Arts at Memorial City
address: 303 Memorial City Way Houston, TX 77024 United States
body: Kids can learn ground acrobatics, hand stands, wire walking and more at this Circus Arts event on The Square at Memorial City Mall. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: ArtIsAn Outdoor Market at Republic Square
address:
13501 Katy Fwy #1000 
Houston, TX 77079 United States
body: Hosted by The Art Cellar of Houston and Republic Square, the ArtIsAn Outdoor Market is a European style market, with a Houston flare that features local Houston artists like sewistas, artisans, florists, and more. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: Beetles, Brew & Barbecue in Tomball
address: Tomball , TX 77375 United States
body: Admire over 100 Volkswagen Beetles at this car show while enjoying craft beer, food and live music from The Allen Oldies Band in Tomball. Admission No cover.

title: The Morning After, A Houston Press Brunch Event at Bayou City Event Center Houston
address:
9401 Knight Rd 
Houston, TX 77045 United States
body: Houston Press presents the 2nd Annual The Morning After Brunch at the Bayou City Event Center Pavilion. This brunch sampling event will feature bites from local brunch hot spots, alongside drink samples & music. Admission Tickets range from $25 to $75.

title: Galveston Island Shrimp Festival
address: Galveston Island, Galveston, TX 77554 United States
body: Get a taste of the island at this local shrimp festival, which features special highlights like Friday’s VIP kick-off party, Saturday’s Gumbo Stroll, the Lil’ Shrimp’s Parade, and an official 5k beginning at 9am on Saturday morning. Admission Tickets start at $10.

title: Oktoberfest Party at Southern Star Brewing
address:
3525 N. Frazier Street 
Conroe, TX 77303 United States
body: Southern Star Brewery in Conroe hosts its annual Oktoberfest party, complete with Oktoberfest beer, authentic polka music performed live by The Moravians, German style food vendors, market vendors, games, and more. The first 500 guests will receive a specialty half liter German stein while supplies last. Admission: Free to enter; $25 gets you an Oktoberfest glass and three beer tickets.

title: Last Saturdaze at Top Vintage
address:
4450 S Wayside Dr #102 
Houston , TX 77087 United States
body: Shop for eclectic vintage clothing while enjoying live music and drink at the Top Vintage clothing warehouse. 30% of their sales will go towards the GHCF Hurricane Harvey Relief Fund. Admission No cover.

title: 1st Anniversary Celebration at Platypus Brewing
address:
1902 Washington Ave, Suite E 
Houston, TX 77007 United States
body: The Platypus Brewery celebrates their 1 year anniversary with a special new beer release, live music, food and fun for the whole family. Admission No cover.

title: Square Arts & Crafts: Abrakadoodle at Memorial City
address: 303 Memorial City Way Houston, TX 77024 United States
body: Bring the kids, ages 5 to 10, to take part in an arts and crafts activity on The Square at Memorial City Mall. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: Fall Festival at Town Green Park
address:
2099 Lake Robbins Dr. 
The Woodlands, TX 77380 United States
body: The Refugee Project hosts a Fall Festival featuring carnival games and rides, face painting, a pumpkin patch, and more fun for the whole family at the Town Green Park in Kingwood. Admission Tickets start at $10.

title: The Houston Black Heritage Music & Arts Festival at Discovery Green
address:
1500 Mckinney St 
Houston, TX 77010 United States
body: Celebrate African and African-American culture with art, music, poetry, food, and community at this outdoor festival at Discovery Green park. Admission Tickets start at $25. Kids under 9 get in free.

title: HTX International Fest at The Silo
address:
4601 Clinton Dr 
Houston, TX 77020 United States
body: The HTX International Fest will celebrate music, dance, and cultures from around the world. Visit with local vendors and check out international foods and crafts at The Silo. Admission Tickets start at $5.

title: Tamale & Salsa Pop Up at Axelrad
address:
1517 Alabama St 
Houston, TX 77004 United States
body: Have a tasty tamale while jamming out to live music as The Hot Damn Tamale Factory sets up at Axelrad. Admission No cover.

title: Brazilian Independence Day Celebration at Capitol Bar
address:
2415 Main St 
Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Head to Capitol Bar for the 2nd Annual Brazilian Independence Day Celebration and enjoy authentic Brazilian cuisine, musical performances, children's activities and educational opportunities. Admission Tickets start at $10.

title: Screaming Like Goku Event at King’s BierHaus
address:
2044 E. T.C. Jester Boulevard 
Houston, TX 77008 United States
body: Achieve Super Saiyan by screaming as loud and hard as you can amongst other Dragon Ball Z fans at King's BierHaus in the Heights. Enjoy food, beer, an arm wrestling contest, costumes and more. Admission No cover charge.

title: Karbachtoberfest at Karbach Brewing Co.
address:
2032 Karbach St 
Houston, TX 77092 United States
body: Celebrate Karbachtoberfest with four weekends of festivities, a German inspired menu, beer, live performances and more. This event is free to attend. Food and drinks are on you.

title: The Square Live! at Memorial City
address:
303 Memorial City Way 
Houston, TX 77024 United States
body: The Square Live! event will feature live music by local acts, dancing, giant games and fun for the whole family at Memorial City. Admission No cover.

title: Matchbox 20 & Counting Crows in Concert in The Woodlands
address:
2005 Lake Robbins Dr 
The Woodlands, TX 77380 United States
body: Counting Crows and Rob Thomas had a ton of success touring with each other last summer, and now Thomas is getting his band back together for another sizzling hot double bill in the A Brief History of Everything tour. Admission: Tickets start at 30$.

title: Equinox Dinner at Brasil Houston
address: 2604 Dunlavy St Houston , TX 77006 United States
body: Join Brasil Cafe in Montrose in supporting community farms and local Houston growers and enjoy this seasonal family-style farm dinner. This event will benefit the growers of Urban Harvest Farmers Market. Admission Tickets are $75 and 25% of ticket proceeds will be donated to farmers and growers in need of relief from Hurricane Harvey.

title: Young the Giant in Concert at White Oak Music Hall
address:
2915 N Main Street 
Houston, TX 77009 United States
body: See the California rock band, Young the Giant with openers Cold War Kids and Joywave at White Oak Music Hall. Admission Tickets start at $32.

title: RuPaul’s Drag Race Trixie Mattel & Thorgy Thor at South Beach
address: 810 Pacific St Houston, TX 77006 United States
body: Sashay into the LGBT-friendly nightclub, South Beach, and experience a performance from 2 of RuPaul's Drag Race quirkiest queens, Trixie Mattel and Thorgy Thor. Doors at 9pm, show begins around 11pm. Admission Cover charge at the door.

title: The Sour Notes in Concert at Satellite Bar
address: 6922 Harrisburg Blvd Houston, TX 77011 United States
body: Austin-based indie rock band The Sour Notes performs at Satellite Bar in the East End with openers Cool Moon and Mourning Bliss. Admission This event is free to attend for over 21 and $7 for under 21.

title: Disco in Space at Numbers Nightclub
address:
300 Westheimer 
Houston, TX 77006 United States
body: Dance to funk and disco and come dressed in your sci-fi costume for this space-themed party at Numbers Nightclub. Admission Tickets are $13 at the door.

title: Stranger Things ’80s Party at Marquee Moon Lounge
address:
7419 Navigation Blvd 
Houston , TX 77011 United States
body: Wear your best '80s clothes and experience the "upside down" at this '80s Stranger Things-themed party at Marquee Moon Lounge. Admission No cover.

title: The Late Show at Prohibition Supperclub & Bar
address:
1008 Prairie 
Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Step into the Roaring 20s, when skirts were short and booze was a secret pleasure. The Moonlight Dolls and special guests perform classic and tasteful stripteases, plus vocalists, dancers, and aerialists showcasing their signature acts. Admission: Tickets are 40$.
